subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Call of Cthul hu: Typo Report: ¶6, ¶7; more nam e-dot confusion
msgSnippet: ... The first edition of LPD (1990) says: *to* strong form [tu:], weak forms [tu], [t@] *too* [tu:] -- this word has no weak form. *two* [tu:] (= _too_). No
messageBody:
2013-05-19 00:02, Nathan Sharfi skrev:
> I'm looking at that page (11) now, where a few paragraphs prior, "two" is spelled as if it's pronounced [tu]. Joy. Guess "too", "to", and "two" aren't all homophones in Readland.

The first edition of LPD (1990) says:
*to* strong form [tu:], weak forms [tu], [t@]
*too* [tu:] -- this word has no weak form.
*two* [tu:] (= _too_).
No indication of differing GenAm/RP pronunciations though!

So the problem is that QS has no way of unambiguously spelling
the 'intermediate' [u], but it seems sensible to make a
distinction and spell out _to_ as <tU>.

If you're interested in the matter of differences between
GenAm and RP and conservative RP you should definitely get
hold of a copy of the LPD:

<http://www.bookfinder.com/search/?author=Wells&title=Longman+Pronunciation+dictionary&lang=en&st=xl&ac=qr>
